However, reliabilities of the klystron power amplifiers and low noise parametric amplifier receiver front ends employed were not adequate for an operational system. The major operational. difficulty encountered with the Courier system occurred on October 21, 1960, when the satellite ceased to respond to ground terminal "turn on" commands. This left the satellite in an acquisition mode with the UHF communications system and telemetry transmitter deactivated, *and only the VHF beacon transmitter remained active, The exact cause of failure was never determined. Erratic command system in-orbit performance on Courier ,Ib and subsequent life testing of a duplicate satellite model pointed toward a failure of command system circuitry.'
